ThingDef.label: ursine paragon
ThingDef.description: The absolute alpha of units, the chonkiest of bois, winner of consecutive Fat Bear Weeks before being disqualified due to winning too often.\n\nA perfect ursine animal, paragon of all similar animals with no needless junk genetic data. Besides the various improvements to the baseline animal’s abilities, this paragon has a particularly powerful stun attack and can be slaughtered for a valuable pelt, which can either be used for decoration or sold.

ThingDef.label: boomalope paragon
ThingDef.description: While more of a risk to keep around, they are considerably more efficient and don’t eat your crops as much. Plus their permanent sad expression just makes you want to pet them, how can you say no.\n\nA perfect boomalope animal, paragon of all similar animals with no needless junk genetic data. Besides the various improvements to the baseline animal’s abilities, this paragon produces compressed chemfuel instead and explodes on death in a much more violent fashion.

ThingDef.label: avian paragon
ThingDef.description: Sure the little blighter is more stubborn than its progenitor, but not having to gather the eggs so often and a bigger fried egg makes all the difference.\n\nA perfect avian animal, paragon of all similar animals with no needless junk genetic data. Besides the various improvements to the baseline animal’s abilities, this paragon possesses inherent wildness not present in domesticated chickens but is more likely to stay put.

ThingDef.label: muffalo paragon
ThingDef.description: A return to simpler times, when everyone could have sworn blind that muffalos used to be able to produce milk but were instead fooled by hornless paragons.\n\nA perfect muffalo animal, paragon of all similar animals with no needless junk genetic data. Besides the various improvements to the baseline animal’s abilities, this paragon also produces milk and can be slaughtered for a valuable pelt, which can either be used for decoration or sold.

ThingDef.label: canine paragon
ThingDef.description: An improved version of man’s best friend, easier to train, more assertive and dangerous to those that threaten a household. Sadly, far too proud to admit it really wants a belly rub.\n\nA perfect canine animal, paragon of all similar animals with no needless junk genetic data. Besides the various improvements to the baseline animal’s abilities, this paragon can be slaughtered for a valuable pet, which can either be used for decoration or sold.

ThingDef.label: rodent paragon
ThingDef.description: Look, I know what you’re thinking. Why is the rat the paragon of all rodents? And even if you’re not thinking that, this is rhetorical anyway so there. What other rodent has caused civilization to collapse due to poorly held beliefs and lack of proper hygiene. As such, we give you the King Rat. Or Queen Rat, if you want a whole colony showing up.\n\nA perfect rodent animal, paragon of all similar animals with no needless junk genetic data. Besides the various improvements to the baseline animal’s abilities, this paragon has a very fast gestation period and its attacks transmit the plague.

ThingDef.label: reptile paragon
ThingDef.description: Small and venomous, with a deadly fart, not quite what one was expecting for the perfect reptilian form. I mean, you’d think you’d get a tyrannosaurus rex or something but no, it seems that the humble iguana is here to stay. If anything, the shock of something so small moving so fast has got to be worth something.\n\nA perfect reptile animal, paragon of all similar animals with no needless junk genetic data. Besides the various improvements to the baseline animal’s abilities, this paragon is oviparous and can manually rupture neck sacs containing venomous gas.

ThingDef.label: equine paragon
ThingDef.description: The most majestic of horses is proud and magnificent, and doesn’t care for your rules, man. So keep them properly penned up, because they’ll try to escape to freedom so they can run wild and free. And then wonder where all the carrots, sugar cubes and salt licks have disappeared to.\n\nA perfect equine animal, paragon of all similar animals with no needless junk genetic data. Besides the various improvements to the baseline animal’s abilities, this paragon makes for an excellent mount and pack animal for caravans.

ThingDef.label: colossal paragon
ThingDef.description: The gigantic, graceful creature has somehow been improved even further, proving infallibly that there’s always a taller mountain. Significantly easier to train and with a more efficient digestive system, this creature is possibly how the thrumbo originally was when first bred in a lab before it got tainted through terraforming.\n\nA perfect colossal animal, paragon of all similar animals with no needless junk genetic data. Besides the various improvements to the baseline animal’s abilities, this paragon makes for an excellent mount for caravans and can forcibly rush itself, getting faster and creating dust clouds that impede ranged attacks.
